content:
Problem persists in 12.1 - only messages that are newly moved towards the subfolders are shown, but not the old ones that already had been there when Thunderbird 12.0 was installed. IMAP Mailboxes are on freenet.de and gmx.de which are quite common here in Germany.

BTW, K-9 12.1 has the same problem but (at least) does not crash anymore. My old tablet still works, as it seems to be stuck at K-9 10.1 for some reason :-)
creator: sven_gosslau

content: I'm on TB Beta (Android). I uninstalled and reinstalled TB for Android with no success. I also went through all the individual folder setting to try to get it to sync. I'm a zero inbox guy and all my messages are moved out to folders. For me this is a deal breaker and I've moved back to BlueMail until this is fixed. I'm signed up to monitor the thread.
creator: spiperman2

content: Are there any work arounds? Does it work for anyone? Is what host we are on useful for diagnosis?
creator: garyt

content:
garyt said
Are there any work arounds? Does it work for anyone? Is what host we are on useful for diagnosis?

To answer my own question, hopefully for the benefit of anyone else that comes here - yes, there is. On github GerryArqIT suggested a workaround: disabling "Auto-detect IMAP namespace" and leaving IMAP path prefix empty, the problem is gone. Which is under settings/(account)/fetching mail/Incoming server Which works perfectly for me. And it looks like they are working on it.
creator: garyt

content:
This issue is related to imap prefix, which should have been fixed in version 13.

Do you find the issue to be gone?
creator: wsmwk

content: This was fixed in version 12, but will be present in version 11.1 which is what is currently available on the Play Store.
creator: wsmwk
